title: Two more fuel vessels being unloaded
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) said that fuel is being unloaded from two more fuel tankers that reached Sri Lanka.
Chairman of the CPC Attorney-at-Law Sumith Wijesinghe said the two vessels contained stocks of 92 and 95 octane petrol and diesel.
The CPC further noted that fuel is being continuously issued to all filling stations in the country.
However, long queues can still be seen at filling stations across the country.
